headline.main: Milosevic Accused of Secret Use of Funds

lead_paragraph: Slobodan Milosevic secretly financed Serbian military operations in Croatia, Bosnia and Kosovo in the 1990's through Greek and Cypriot bank accounts, according to documents from the United Nations war crimes court that were obtained by Reuters today. Carla Del Ponte, the chief prosecutor at the tribunal, will call on the banks to provide evidence of the accounts said to have been used by Mr. Milosevic, the former Yugoslav president. He is to stand trial next year, charged with genocide in Bosnia and crimes against humanity in all three conflicts.
abstract: Documents from UN war crimes court in the Hague reportedly accuse former Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic of secretly financing Serbian military operations in Croatia, Bosnia and Kosovo in 1990's through Greek and Cypriot bank accounts (S)
